Depending on the type of digs in the area, players can use their trowel or rock pick, along with a specimen brush in their inventory, to dig up several items. Soil can also be found on Fossil Island in the Museum Camp.

Soil can be found throughout the digsite area, and plays an important role in The Dig Site quest. Depending on the type of digs in the area, players can use their trowel or rock pick, along with a specimen brush in their inventory, to dig up several items. Soil can also be found on Fossil Island in the Museum Camp.

Contents

  • 1 Training digs
  • 2 Level 1 digs
  • 3 Level 2 digs
  • 4 Level 3 digs
  • 5 Fossil Island
  • 6 Trivia

Training digs[edit | edit source]

Training digs are the lowest level of digs at the digsite and are located in south section of the digsite area. A trowel is used to dig in the training area, but no additional tools are needed. None of the items obtained from training digs are needed to progress in the quest, and generally have a very low value.

Soil
Level required 1
Mining XP5 xp
Required toolTrowel
Respawn timeN/A

Level 1 digs[edit | edit source]

Level 1 digs are located in the central and eastern portion of the digsite, and are unlocked after passing the first level of the exam during the quest. A trowel is used to dig in the level 1 area, and leather gloves and leather boots must both be worn.

Soil
Level required 1
Mining XP6 xp
Required toolTrowel, Leather gloves and Leather boots
Respawn timeN/A

Level 2 digs[edit | edit source]

Level 2 digs are located in the upper central patches of the digsite, and are unlocked after passing the second level of the exam during the quest. A rock pick is used to dig in the level 2 area.

Soil
Level required 1
Mining XP7 xp
Required toolRock pick
Respawn timeN/A

Level 3 digs[edit | edit source]

Level 3 digs are located in the north-east and central west patches of the digsite. Digging in the level 3 area is unlocked after completing the third level of the exam during the quest. A trowel is used to dig in this area, and a specimen brush and specimen jar must be in the inventory. During the quest, an ancient talisman must be found by digging in the level 3 area, which must be brought to the Archaeological expert to progress in the quest.

Soil
Level required 1
Mining XP8 xp
Required toolTrowel, Specimen brush and Specimen jar

Fossil Island[edit | edit source]

The Fossil Island soil is located in the Museum Camp. A trowel or rock pick can be used to dig. The only possible rewards from digging in the soil are numulite and fossils.

Soil
Level required 1
Mining XP5 xp
Required toolRock pick or Trowel
Respawn timeN/A

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Attempting to use a tool in the incorrect digsite soil will cause the closest Digsite workman to interrupt and explain the proper usage. If no digsite workman is within range, the message will appear in the chatbox instead.
  • The various types of digs are based on the location of the player, not the specific instance of the soil. This means if the player is standing on the tile outside the digging region, none of the tools can be used to successfully dig. Instead, the player will only state that they should try using a different tool.
  • The animation while digging at the Fossil Island digs will always show a trowel, even if a rock pick is used. Similarly, the chat message while digging up numulite will state that you clean it off with your brush, even if there is no specimen brush in the inventory.
